{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3306625,"name":"Noah Simon","username":"tubularturtle8","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tubularturtle8/{size}/209634_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T23:03:23.030Z","cooked":"

Our team is using a motor-driven 4 bar intake this season. We are new to this, and so I was wondering: is there a better way, beyond a profiled PID controller, to control the system? We are using feed forward models for the rest of our robot’s subsystems, but I couldn’t find any FF models for a 4-bar. Am I wrong in thinking that it is too complex a system to reasonably tune feed-forward for? If I am not, are there any other alternatives to not make this a purely PID controlled system?

Thanks!
Noah
Team Optix 3749 President and Programmer

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-02-10T23:03:23.030Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":40,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":238.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":454258,"topic_slug":"feed-forward-for-a-4-bar-linkage","display_username":"Noah Simon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56141,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team Optix 3749 | Programmer, Drive Team"},"post_url":"/t/feed-forward-for-a-4-bar-linkage/454258/1","custom_user_title":"Team Optix 3749 | Programmer, Drive Team","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3306632,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T23:11:36.071Z","cooked":"

The main question is why is a profiled PID not good enough here? A standard profiled PID controller can be perfectly suitable for many situations. For many 2 position intakes even a bang-bang control system will suffice.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-02-10T23:11:36.071Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":186,"readers_count":185,"score":42.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":454258,"topic_slug":"feed-forward-for-a-4-bar-linkage","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"post_url":"/t/feed-forward-for-a-4-bar-linkage/454258/2","custom_user_title":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3306641,"name":"Eric Ward","username":"bathtubed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T23:21:57.127Z","cooked":"

I might be oversimplifying, but I think a 4-bar linkage can just be modeled the same as an arm.

If there is a difference (due to the center of mass potentially moving slightly differently from a circle), I think it would still model the effects of gravity well enough to be a vast improvement, and PID could do the rest.

For an arm you’re almost always going to want a feedforward, whether or not you have a motion profile.
